slides.title: Introduction to General Awareness
slides.content:
**General Awareness for Anganwadi Workers**

This section tests your knowledge of:
- Current Affairs
- Indian History
- Geography
- Indian Culture

**Why it matters:** As an Anganwadi worker, you need to be aware of social, cultural, and current issues affecting communities.

slides.title: Indian History - Ancient India
slides.content:
**Major Civilizations**

**Indus Valley Civilization (3300-1300 BCE)**
- Major cities: Harappa, Mohenjo-Daro
- Well-planned cities with drainage systems
- Known for trade and urban planning

**Vedic Period**
- Four Vedas: Rigveda, Samaveda, Yajurveda, Atharvaveda
- Foundation of Hindu culture and religion

**Mauryan Empire**
- Founded by Chandragupta Maurya
- Emperor Ashoka spread Buddhism
- Built pillars and stupas across India

slides.title: Indian History - Medieval Period
slides.content:
**Important Dynasties**

**Delhi Sultanate (1206-1526)**
- Five dynasties ruled Delhi
- Introduction of Islamic architecture
- Qutub Minar built during this period

**Mughal Empire (1526-1857)**
- Founded by Babur
- Akbar, Jahangir, Shah Jahan, Aurangzeb were famous rulers
- Taj Mahal built by Shah Jahan
- Rich cultural and architectural heritage

**Maratha Empire**
- Led by Shivaji Maharaj
- Strong resistance to Mughal rule

slides.title: Indian History - Freedom Struggle
slides.content:
**Key Events**

**1857 - First War of Independence**
- Revolt against British East India Company
- Mangal Pandey was a key figure

**1885 - Indian National Congress formed**
- First President: W.C. Bonnerjee

**1919 - Jallianwala Bagh Massacre**
- Brutal killing of peaceful protesters

**1920-22 - Non-Cooperation Movement**
- Led by Mahatma Gandhi

**1930 - Salt March (Dandi March)**
- Gandhi's protest against salt tax

**1942 - Quit India Movement**
- Final push for independence

**August 15, 1947 - Independence Day**

slides.title: Indian Geography - Physical Features
slides.content:
**Major Physical Divisions**

**1. The Himalayas**
- Highest mountain range in the world
- Mt. Everest (8,849 m) - highest peak
- Source of major rivers: Ganga, Yamuna, Brahmaputra

**2. Northern Plains**
- Formed by rivers Ganga, Brahmaputra, Indus
- Most fertile region
- Highly populated

**3. Peninsular Plateau**
- Deccan Plateau is the largest
- Rich in minerals

**4. Coastal Plains**
- Eastern and Western coastal plains

**5. Islands**
- Andaman & Nicobar (Bay of Bengal)
- Lakshadweep (Arabian Sea)

slides.title: Indian Geography - States and Capitals
slides.content:
**Important States and Capitals**

**North India:**
- Delhi - New Delhi (Capital of India)
- Uttar Pradesh - Lucknow
- Punjab - Chandigarh
- Haryana - Chandigarh

**South India:**
- Tamil Nadu - Chennai
- Karnataka - Bengaluru
- Kerala - Thiruvananthapuram
- Andhra Pradesh - Amaravati

**East India:**
- West Bengal - Kolkata
- Bihar - Patna
- Odisha - Bhubaneswar

**West India:**
- Maharashtra - Mumbai
- Gujarat - Gandhinagar
- Rajasthan - Jaipur

slides.title: Indian Culture - Festivals
slides.content:
**Major Indian Festivals**

**Hindu Festivals:**
- Diwali - Festival of Lights
- Holi - Festival of Colors
- Dussehra/Navratri - Victory of good over evil
- Raksha Bandhan - Brother-sister bond

**Muslim Festivals:**
- Eid-ul-Fitr - End of Ramadan
- Eid-ul-Adha - Festival of Sacrifice

**Sikh Festivals:**
- Guru Nanak Jayanti - Birth of Guru Nanak
- Baisakhi - Harvest festival

**Christian Festivals:**
- Christmas - Birth of Jesus Christ
- Good Friday - Crucifixion of Jesus

**National Festivals:**
- Republic Day (26 January)
- Independence Day (15 August)
- Gandhi Jayanti (2 October)

slides.title: Current Affairs - Key Topics
slides.content:
**Areas to Focus On**

**National News:**
- Government schemes and policies
- Major appointments and resignations
- New laws and bills passed
- Economic developments

**International News:**
- Important global events
- India's relations with other countries
- International organizations (UN, WHO, etc.)

**Sports:**
- Major tournaments and winners
- Indian achievements in sports
- Olympic games results

**Awards and Honours:**
- Nobel Prize winners
- Bharat Ratna, Padma Awards
- National and international awards

**Science and Technology:**
- ISRO missions and achievements
- New inventions and discoveries

question.questionText: Which Mughal emperor built the Taj Mahal?
question.explanation: Shah Jahan built the Taj Mahal in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal. It is located in Agra and is one of the Seven Wonders of the World.
